intro: Mendoncia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with opposite, simple leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, dark berries as fruit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
